segments.text: Oh no, look at that sink just gushing water all over the place.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's foot is in the puddle, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's polishing that plate like nothing's wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water's ruining the cabinets, streaming down the doors.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids are up to no good with the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool is tilting back, the boy could tumble any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's stretching so far, plate in one hand, cookies in the other.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, hand out like she expects treats.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why isn't the mom turning around to see this chaos?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor's getting so slippery from the spill.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside the window, everything's calm in the garden.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This could end in tears if someone slips or falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could warn them before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
